Comments_List: I learned a lot about a number of famous, important topics in Game Theory
not much but the little I learned was useful as a way of thinking
Learned about fairness and stability of profit sharing methods, bargaining solutions, mixed strategy equilibria, etc.
Great

Learnt principles of cooperative game theory
mathematical thinking with minimal use of symbols

Need more problem sets/
It was a great Course and instructor was very in tune with what students wanted/didn't want to do. Really tailored the class to the students and made the material exciting and interesting
it is a seminar taught as a lecture. Be more interactive so people actually pay attention
This class should be offered as a lecture, there was no seminar style engagement
Very well taught, exams were reasonably fair.
Great class. Honestly loved it.
Great
The professor was the best; he really loves what he is doing.

This class is an awesome option if you need to fulfill an econ/applied math credit. It's quite chill, but you get a great understanding of a few key concepts of game theory. Pradeep is genuinely concerned with his students learning, not just making them do work. He's funny and highly enthusiastic about what he does.
Would absolutely recommend this course! Professor Dubey is an amazing Professor and truly cares about his teachings. Topics are very interesting.
Absolutely. I loved this course and the professor is awesome.
great easy senior seminar, you do have to show up though
This class is extremely low workload, but isnt really worth it. Interesting material, but painfully boring delivery in long Fri morn seminar.
Great senior seminar if you are interested in game theory. Even if you have taken game theory courses in the past, you will likely learn lots of new material in this class.
Yes
